messages.title: Election must focus on party policies
messages.content: The most important election in this country in 30 years will be held next week.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Economic recovery will be protected, schools and hospitals will continue to be properly funded.
Corrupt MPs will be subject to voter recall; the link between earnings and pensions will be restored.
Climate change will be tackled, more students will go into higher education, and the national minimum wage will continue to rise.
The North-East will be targeted for public sector job cuts; the UK economy will be threatened by deeper public expenditure cuts.
The rich will get a £200,000 tax cut by raising the inheritance tax threshold to £1 million.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Hexham is no longer a safe Conservative seat - the Tory majority is now only 5,000, and the seat may be swiped out in this election if enough people vote Labour.

issues.brexitEurope: To lose the pound and the chance to protect sterling, requiring us to bail out Greece?
issues.economy: Protecting economic recovery; schools and hospitals to continue to be funded; addressing public sector job cuts.
issues.education: More students will go into higher education.
issues.governance: Voter recall for corrupt MPs; restoring the link between earnings and pensions.
issues.health: Hospitals will continue to be properly funded.
issues.immigration: card for immigrants that sell joints to kids'.
issues.socialWelfare: Winter Fuel Allowance, Child’s Trust Fund, and Child Tax Credits mentioned in the context of policies that may be cut by the opposition.

leaflet.personalStatement: I’m proud to be able to say that I am North-East 'born and bred'.

quotes.text: A vote for the LibDems is a vote for propping the anti-Tory Tories by sneaking in a win just the same as voting LibDem will.
If you’re tempted by the LibDems, ask yourself this: do you really want to vote for an amnesty for illegal immigrants? For a ‘get out of jail free’ card for immigrants that sell joints to kids?
